titles.title: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2000
To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site in the State of Colorado.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 10/3/2000--Introduced. Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2000 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the National Park Service, to establish in Kiowa County, Colorado, the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site to commemorate the massacre of more than 150 Cheyenne and Arapaho Indians who were murdered by U.S. soldiers along Sand Creek in southeastern Colorado territory on November 29, 1864.
